:::bio
### Chelsey Legacy

Student<br />2017--2022

Chelsey Legacy finished her doctoral work in 2022. Her dissertation topic was: [Understanding the development of students' multivariate statistical thinking in a data visualization course](https://iase-web.org/Publications.php?p=Dissertations). Chelsey is an Assistant Professor of Teaching in the Department of Educational Psychology at the University of Minnesota. To learn more, visit her [faculty page](https://www.cehd.umn.edu/edpsych/people/legac006/).
:::
:::

### Jonathan Brown

Student<br />201x--2021

Jonathan Brown finished his doctoral work in 2021. his dissertation topic was: [Student Understanding of the Hypothetical Nature of Simulations in Introductory Statistics](https://iase-web.org/Publications.php?p=Dissertations). Jonathan is a Research and Project Management Analyst at the Office of Measurement Services at the University of Minnesota. :::bio
### Anelise Sabbag

Student<br />2011--2016

Anelise Sabbag started as a Master's student in 2011. She then entered the Ph.D. program in 2013 and finished her doctoral work in 2016. Her dissertation topic was: [Examining the Relationship between Statistical Literacy and Statistical Reasoning](https://iase-web.org/Publications.php?p=Dissertations). Anelise is an Associate Professor in the Department of Statistics at Cal Poly, San Luis Obispo. To learn more, visit her [Faculty page](https://statistics.calpoly.edu/anelise-sabbag).
:::
:::

Matt Beckman was a Ph.D. student from 2009--2015. :::bio
### Jiyoon Park

Student<br />2008--2012

Jiyoon Park was a Ph.D. student from 2008--2012. Her dissertation topic was: [Developing and Validating an Instrument to Measure College Students' Inferential Reasoning in Statistics: An Argument-Based Approach to Validation](https://iase-web.org/Publications.php?p=Dissertations). Jiyoon currently works as an AI scientist at AstraZeneca leading a methodology team in developing Benefit Risk Assessment framework to evaluate drugs' benefits and risks in product development Lifecyle. To learn more, visit her [LinkedIn page](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jiyoon-park-07119559/).
